sentences.english: A lot of expeditions stock up on that before they go.
sentences.chinese: 不少遠征團出發前，都備好大量肯達爾薄荷餅。

sentences.english: Until last hurt, I will not awake?
sentences.chinese: 直到最後的傷害，我才肯醒悟嗎？

sentences.english: Early one morning, Shmi was attacked and abducted by the savage Tusken Raiders.
sentences.chinese: 一天清晨，野蠻的塔斯肯襲擊者毆打併綁架了施密。

sentences.english: Buddha Bodhisattva only bless people willing to help themselves.
sentences.chinese: 佛菩薩只保佑那些肯幫助自己的人。

sentences.english: At long last, Lonnie is releasing his most cherished professional performance pices.
sentences.chinese: 他終於肯願意傳授他最專業的表演內容。

sentences.english: His argument does not get to the heart of the topic.
sentences.chinese: 他的這篇議論文並沒有把握住主題的肯綮。

sentences.english: My cousin Ken always talks to others in class.
sentences.chinese: 我的表弟肯總是在課上與別人說話。

sentences.english: Everyone would get progress, if he or her really wants to try.
sentences.chinese: 人總是會進步的只要自己肯去努力。

sentences.english: TOMMY: Ken, you get the first run of counterfeit cash TOMMY: and put three mil in briefcases.

sentences.english: Only you study hard can you get good results.
sentences.chinese: 只有肯努力，才能得到好的學習成績。

sentences.english: Of course I would go, I replied respectfully.
sentences.chinese: 我當然肯去，我恭敬地回稟師父。

sentences.english: My daughter didn't go to bed until Teletubbies ended.
sentences.chinese: 我女兒直到《天線寶寶》結束才肯上牀睡覺。

definition: to wish/to want/ready/willing (to do sth)
to be willing to/to resign oneself to
to be willing to part with sth
would rather/better
to give up/to abandon (a goal etc)/to let sth go/forget it/let the matter drop
to be willing to do sth/to be ready to do sth/to be happy to do sth/content/satisfied
willingness/would rather (agree to X than Y)
to let go of sth held in one's mouth/(fig.) to relent/to yield
would rather.../it would be better.../would prefer
to dare/daring/(polite) may I venture
preferably/one would prefer to...(or not to...)/would rather/(would) be better to/(to pick) the lesser of two evils
unwilling/unwillingness
life or death/fate/no matter what/anyway/for the life of me
to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
to let go one's hold/to give up/to have a free hand
delighted to (do sth, idiom)/perfectly happy to do/most willing to do
